text: Peter John Goy (8 June 1938 – 12 April 2021) was an English professional footballer who played as a goalkeeper. He turned professional in June 1955 and continued to play for the youth team until 1956. He played two matches for Arsenal, his debut against Leeds United on 24 February 1959 (which Arsenal won 1–0) and the second against Birmingham City on 4 May 1959. He later played for Southend United, Watford and Huddersfield Town, before moving to South Africa, then living at Shoeburyness, Essex. ==References== * Category:1938 births Category:2021 deaths Category:English footballers Category:Association football goalkeepers Category:Arsenal F.C. players Category:Huddersfield Town A.F.C. players Category:Sportspeople from Yorkshire Category:Watford F.C. players
title: Peter Goy
